title: Frequent Power Outage in Mirpur
description:
Over the last month Mirpur-10 residents have experienced daily power interruptions.
Outages typically occur between 7:00 PM and 11:00 PM, affecting lighting and home appliances.
Many households report sensitive electronics being damaged due to abrupt voltage drops.
Local businesses face revenue loss during peak evening hours when store traffic is highest.
Residents have filed repeated complaints with the utility but improvements have been intermittent.

title: Gas Supply Fluctuation in Dhanmondi
description:
Several apartment complexes in Dhanmondi report low gas pressure at peak hours.
Households are unable to cook during morning and evening rush times because burners fail to ignite properly.
Maintenance crews have been seen at main regulators, but the issue recurs after a few days.
Tenants are concerned about safety due to repeated pilot light problems and risk of incomplete combustion.
Community leaders are requesting a permanent regulator upgrade from the gas company.

title: Contaminated Tap Water in Uttara Sector 6
description:
Residents noticed brownish discoloration and unusual odor in tap water for several days.
Families have avoided using tap water for drinking and report increased use of bottled water.
Local health posts logged cases of stomach upset possibly linked to water quality.
Municipal crews shut off supply temporarily to flush the main lines and promised testing results.
Citizens are demanding timely public reports and corrective infrastructure work for lines and treatment.

title: Slow Broadband and Frequent Disconnects - Gulshan
description:
Office workers in Gulshan experience persistent slow speeds during business hours.
Video conferences drop repeatedly, affecting remote meetings and client calls.
Multiple users report technician visits but intermittent restoration only lasts a day or two.
Businesses dependent on cloud services incur lost time and missed deadlines.
Customers are asking the ISP for SLA enforcement or a plan upgrade to resolve congestion.

title: Transformer Failure Causes Blackout - Khulna Road
description:
A transformer failure on Khulna Road caused an extended blackout affecting a wide area.
Emergency services and traffic signals were disrupted for several hours during the incident.
Repair crews replaced damaged components but full stabilization took the better part of the day.
Local merchants suffered losses as refrigerated goods spoiled without power.
Officials posted an incident report and scheduled an inspection of nearby substations.

title: High Water Bill After Meter Replacement - Narayanganj
description:
Several households received unexpectedly high water bills after a recent meter swap.
Residents assert consumption patterns did not changeâ€”no extra guests or new appliances.
Meter calibration checks were requested but community reports slow administrative response.
Consumers worry about estimated readings and want transparent meter verification.
A local consumer group plans to file a formal appeal with municipal water authorities.

title: Internet Outage During Online Exams - Rajshahi University Area
description:
Students faced ISP outage during scheduled online exams leading to missed submissions.
Examination authorities received many late-penalty appeals because of connectivity loss.
The ISP blamed backbone maintenance but provided no prior notice to educational institutions.
Calls for compensation or make-up exams have been submitted to both university and ISP.
Stakeholders request a reliable alternate link or better outage notification procedures.

title: Cooking Gas Leak Reported in Mirzapur
description:
A suspected domestic gas leak prompted an emergency response from the local gas office.
Neighbors reported the smell of gas and the family evacuated until technicians arrived.
Technicians detected a loose regulator fitting and replaced the faulty connector.
Officials advised periodic safety checks and distributed leaflets on gas-safety practices.
Follow-up inspections were scheduled to ensure corrections and prevent repeat incidents.

title: Rising Electricity Tariff Confusion - Old Dhaka
description:
Residents received bills reflecting a new tariff slab that many did not expect.
Community leaders say the tariff notice was not clearly communicated in local language.
Small shopkeepers are particularly concerned about increased monthly operating costs.
Requests for a detailed bill breakdown and tariff FAQ were sent to the utility office.
A public meeting with utility representatives has been proposed to clarify charges.

title: Intermittent Water Pressure After Roadwork - Barishal
description:
Road reconstruction disturbed an old water main leading to inconsistent pressure.
Some households experience high pressure bursts while others report barely any flow.
Municipal teams are coordinating to locate weakened joints and replace damaged sections.
Schools and clinics in the area requested priority restoration to maintain services.
A timeline for phased repairs was published to keep the public informed and reduce anxiety.

title: Fiber Cut During Construction Causes Internet Downtime - Sylhet
description:
Construction crews accidentally severed a fiber backbone causing region-wide downtime.
Repair required specialized splicing teams and spare parts which took several hours to arrive.
Local businesses and remote workers experienced prolonged disruption in connectivity.
The ISP offered temporary mobile hotspot credits to affected customers as a goodwill gesture.
Anti-digging protocols are being reviewed to avoid similar future infrastructure damage.

title: Emergency Generator Reliance Raises Electricity Costs - Cox's Bazar
description:
Frequent grid instability forced several hotels to run backup generators regularly.
Generator fuel consumption significantly increased monthly energy bills for businesses.
Tourist-season demand amplifies the financial impact on small guesthouses operating tight margins.
Operators request grid stabilization and prioritized infrastructure investment for the region.
A collaborative meeting between hoteliers and power authorities is being arranged.
